intro: Agoseris leontodon, commonly known as the golden crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of gray-green, hairy leaves and produces showy yellow ray florets surrounded by orange-brown disk florets. Agoseris leontodon thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
